newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Foreigners to be allowed 49 pct of SAfrica Sun Air.
newsitem.headline: Foreigners to be allowed 49 pct of SAfrica Sun Air.

text.p: South African has decided to offer 49 percent of state-run Sun Air to foreign buyers, instead of the 25 percent initially planned, Public Enterprises Minister Stella Sigcau told a conference on Monday.

Local newspapers quoted her as saying that the rest of the equity in the soon-to-privatised airline would be divided among local companies and workers, meaning that a foreign concern buying into the company could in effect hold a controlling stake.
Richard Branson's Virgin Atlantic Airways has already expressed an interest in buying a substantial stake in the airline to develop it into a pan-African low-cost regional carrier.
Other airlines thought to be interested include KLM Royal Dutch Airlines and Malaysia Airline Systems.
President Nelson Mandela said on Friday that Sun Air -- in the forefront on the country's privatisation dirve, along with telecommunications group Telkom -- would be privatised "within months".
